abstract.text: Follow along as we demonstrate how you can use Object Capture and RealityKit to bring real-world objects into an augmented reality game. We‚Äôll show you how to capture detailed items using the Object Capture framework, add them to a RealityKit project in Xcode, apply stylized shaders and animations, and use them as part of an AR experience. We‚Äôll also share best practices when working with ARKit, RealityKit, and Object Capture.

metadata.title: Bring your world into augmented reality

abstract.text: Xcode 14, Swift 5.7, iOS 16, macOS 13 (Ventura), tvOS 16, watchOS 9.

Object Capture provides a quick and easy way to create lifelike 3D models of real-world objects using just a few images. Learn how you can get started and bring your assets to life with Photogrammetry for macOS. And discover best practices with object selection and image capture to help you achieve the highest-quality results.

Creating engaging AR experiences has never been easier with RealityKit 2. Explore the latest enhancements to the RealityKit framework and take a deep dive into this underwater sample project. We‚Äôll take you through the improved Entity Component System, streamlined animation pipeline, and the plug-and-play character controller with enhancements to face mesh and audio.

Create stunning visuals for your augmented reality experiences with cutting-edge rendering advancements in RealityKit. Learn the art of writing custom shaders, draw real-time dynamic meshes, and explore creative post-processing effects to help you stylize your AR scene.
Session notes shared by the community for the community.

Discover how you can build more refined and powerful augmented reality apps with ARKit 6. We‚Äôll explore how you can create AR experiences rendered in 4K HDR and take you through camera settings customizations for your app. We‚Äôll also share how you can export high-resolution still images from an ARKit session, take advantage of Plane Estimation and Motion Capture, and add AR Location Anchors in new regions.
